## Discussion

In the base class implementation of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/allocateRenderResources()] method, the value of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/renderResourcesAllocated] property is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. If the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/allocateRenderResources()] method fails in a subclass, you must use this method to set the value of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/renderResourcesAllocated] property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

# setRenderResourcesAllocated(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the Boolean value of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/renderResourcesAllocated] property.

## Declaration

```swift
func setRenderResourcesAllocated(_ flag: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **flag**: A Boolean value that determines whether the audio unit has allocated its required rendering resources..

## Discussion

In the base class implementation of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/allocateRenderResources()] method, the value of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/renderResourcesAllocated] property is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. If the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/allocateRenderResources()] method fails in a subclass, you must use this method to set the value of the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/renderResourcesAllocated] property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Customizing the Audio Unit Behavior

- **registerSubclass(_:as:name:version:)**: Registers an audio unit subclass.
- **shouldChange(to:for:)**: This is called when you set the format on a bus.
- **internalRenderBlock**: The block which you must provide, via a getter, in order to implement rendering.
- **midiOutputBufferSizeHint**
- **AUInternalRenderBlock**: A block to render the audio unit.
